programmes.show_description: A young orphan girl Justine falls into a world of cruel depravity while her sister Juliette thrives in vice. Adaptation of de Sade's novel. Contains distressing scenes and nudity.
8/8. Londoners Lily and Natasha have bought a decrepit narrowboat at a knock-down price. Will their DIY enthusiasm override their lack of experience?
It is March, and Ruth Goodman, Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn greet the long-awaited arrival of spring. It is time to bring in the daffodil harvest.
10/15. In London, Rick tries craft beer in a John Dory sauce. Later, he enjoys borscht at a Ukrainian restaurant and brings back chicken Kiev

10/15. In London, Rick tries craft beer in a John Dory sauce. Later, he enjoys borscht at a Ukrainian restaurant and brings back chicken Kiev
British boxing comedy. Following his trainer's sudden death, Doug inherits a crumbling gym, packed full of crazy would-be fighters. Stars Brad Moore and Denise Van Outen.
Bawdy seventies sketch comedy film starring a bevy of British talent from Bruce Forsyth and Harry Secombe to Joan Simms and June Whitfield. Contains 70s social attitudes.
Comedy. When a lottery winner dies of shock, the townsfolk in his rural Irish village attempt to claim the winnings.
Action. Would-be journalist Sonya Winter investigates the Assassination Bureau, a mysterious organization. Ollie Reed and Diana Rigg star.
Action. Tianhuo Island is paradise in the Pacific. Such a shame it's located in the Ring of Fire, a world-famous volcanic belt. Guess what happens. Jason Isaacs stars.
Four satirical tales of hapless men - who should know better - getting into extra-marital affairs. Reflects early 70s attitudes and contains sexual scenes.
Swinging London, 1969. Zooming around London in his E-type Jaguar, Peter is an arrogant womaniser who picks up a variety of dolly birds. Contains sex scenes.
Kevin McNally stars as Porthos, one of the Three Musketeers, in this award-winning short drama.
Charming modern British comedy-romance. Three bored young women decide to go on holiday together to deepest Norfolk. With Sara Crowe, Nadia Sawalha and Leslie Philips.
Stories of people who have experienced infidelity, the reasons why people stray outside their relationship and if a relationship can ever survive.

Interviews with 19 men and women who were part of the Battle of Britain - unique accounts of the parts they played in the nation's defence, in their own words.
Comedy. A despondent man hires a professional assassin to take himself out. Stars David Jason and Monty Python's Graham Chapman.
Spy thriller. Promising Oxford University students are disappearing. An M15 investigation uncovers a pattern of accidents and arrests. Is the KGB involved? Terence Stamp stars.
Comedy. The story of Great Train Robber Buster Edwards, a small-timer who fell in with more ambitious thieves. Phil Collins and Julie Walters star.
Simon Templar is on holiday in Naples when he intervenes between an arguing Englishman and Italian. So begins his investigation into mafia crime. Roger Moore stars.
In this period caper, set in 1930s England, romance blooms between two very different people, an American thief and an Irish woman.
A shy astrology columnist is ordered to spice up his column by having affairs with a woman from each star sign then writing about it. Contains sex scenes and 80s social attitudes.
